newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares extend losses on limp volume.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares extend losses on limp volume.

text.p: Slovenian shares ended lower on poor volume on Friday following Thursday's decision by the Constitutional Court that the EU association accord cannot be ratified before the country's legislation is changed.
Traders said the SBI index could fall by three to four percent over the next week.
The Ljubljana bourse on Friday announced that it had changed the SBI index at the beginning of the month to include port operator Luka Koper.
At the same time the bourse excluded pharmaceutical wholesaler Salus and financial consultancy Nika .
* The SBI index eased 0.51 percent or 6.77 points to 1,309.19.
* Luka Koper was the top gainer, soaring 2.51 percent to 1,799 tolars on volume of 1,000 shares on expectations of a dividend payout.
* Ordinary shares of Dolenjska bank led the day's decliners, tumbling 5.24 percent to 14,100 tolars on volume of 42 shares. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
